description: a(1) = 1; for n>1, sum of binomial(n,k) as k runs over RRS(n), the reduced residue system of n.
comments: a(n) is a multiple of n for all n.
links: Laszlo Toth, Weighted gcd-sum functions, J. Integer Sequences, 14 (2011), Article 11.7.7
example: For n=prime, a(n)=2^n-2 because all k<=n except 0 and n are used; n=10, RRS[10]={1,3,7,9}, the corresponding coefficients are {10,120,120,10}, so the sum a(10)=260.
mathematica: f[n_] := Plus @@ Binomial[n, Select[ Range[n], GCD[n, # ] == 1 &]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 33}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 04 2004 *)
author: _Labos Elemer_, Aug 02 2000
